result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J. Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases. 
Continue with self-help meetings.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J. Evans

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status.  
Discharge date: 05/12/18
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph J. Evans in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #4:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

12 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:   2 YEARS       **transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug aparphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Continue with self-help meetings
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joseph J. Evans in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #4.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #4.  Counts #1-3 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Bricco requests a sentencing date.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-04-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Joseph J. Evans in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is amended to a felony.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Bound over.  Information is filed. Reading is waived.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Bricco requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-02-2016 10:00 am

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Joseph J. Evans did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear due to being in custody somewhere else.  Court adjourns.  State files an amended criminal complaint (making this case a felony).  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentence (and waiver of preliminary hearing).    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-08-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Joseph J. Evans in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing at 11-06-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Joseph J. Evans in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests an adjourned date as she was just assigned to this case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 10-02-2015 09:00 am
Hearing at 09-25-2015 08:30 am

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Joseph J. Evans in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  State has no offer to amend charges.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
